info.title: Dynamic API Specification
info.description: This is a dynamically generated API specification for all endpoints existing on the current project.

get.description: Image typed files can be dynamically resized and transformed to fit any need.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the asset size configured in settings.

parameters.name: transforms
parameters.description: A JSON array of image transformations

parameters.name: download
parameters.description: Download the asset to your computer

email.description: Email address of the user you're retrieving the access token for.

mode.description: Whether to retrieve the refresh token in the JSON response, or in a httpOnly cookie.

otp.description: The user's one-time-password (if MFA is enabled).

refresh_token.description: JWT access token you want to refresh. This token can't be expired.

mode.description: Whether to submit and retrieve the refresh token in the JSON response, or in a httpOnly cookie.

refresh_token.description: The refresh token to invalidate. If you have the refresh token in a cookie through /auth/login, you don't have to submit it here.

mode.description: Whether the refresh token is submitted in the JSON response, or in a httpOnly cookie.

post.description: Request a reset password email to be send.

email.description: Email address of the user you're requesting a reset for.

post.description: The request a password reset endpoint sends an email with a link to the admin app which in turn uses this endpoint to allow the user to reset their password.

token.description: One-time use JWT token that is used to verify the user.

get.description: List configured OAuth providers.
Start OAuth flow using the specified provider

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Key of the activated OAuth provider.

parameters.name: redirect
parameters.description:
Where to redirect on successful login.
If set the authentication details are set inside cookies otherwise a JSON is returned.

get.description: Perform a system status check and return the options.

parameters.description: The first time you create a project, the provided token will be saved and required for subsequent project installs. It can also be found and configured in `/config/__api.json` on your server.
parameters.name: super_admin_token

get.description: Ping, pong. Ping.. pong.
List the files.
Retrieve a single file by unique identifier.
List the users.
Retrieve a single user by unique identifier.
Retrieve the currently authenticated user.
List the block_button items.
Retrieve a single block_button item by unique identifier.
List the block_posts items.
Retrieve a single block_posts item by unique identifier.
List the block_button_group items.
Retrieve a single block_button_group item by unique identifier.
List the block_hero items.
Retrieve a single block_hero item by unique identifier.
List the block_gallery_items items.
Retrieve a single block_gallery_items item by unique identifier.
List the block_gallery items.
Retrieve a single block_gallery item by unique identifier.
List the block_form items.
Retrieve a single block_form item by unique identifier.
List the globals items.
Retrieve a single globals item by unique identifier.
List the block_pricing items.
Retrieve a single block_pricing item by unique identifier.
List the block_pricing_cards items.
Retrieve a single block_pricing_cards item by unique identifier.
List the form_fields items.
Retrieve a single form_fields item by unique identifier.
List the navigation_items items.
Retrieve a single navigation_items item by unique identifier.
List the page_blocks items.
Retrieve a single page_blocks item by unique identifier.
List the block_richtext items.
Retrieve a single block_richtext item by unique identifier.
List the forms items.
Retrieve a single forms item by unique identifier.
List the navigation items.

List the redirects items.
Retrieve a single redirects item by unique identifier.
List the posts items.
Retrieve a single posts item by unique identifier.
List the pages items.
Retrieve a single pages item by unique identifier.

tags.name: Assets
tags.description: Image typed files can be dynamically resized and transformed to fit any need.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: All data within the platform is private by default. The public role can be configured to expose data without authentication, or you can pass an access token to the API to access private data.

tags.name: Server
tags.description: Access to where Directus runs. Allows you to make sure your server has everything needed to run the platform, and check what kind of latency we're dealing with.

tags.name: Files
tags.description: Files can be saved in any given location. Directus has a powerful assets endpoint that can be used to generate thumbnails for images on the fly.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: Users are what gives you access to the data.

tags.name: ItemsRedirects
tags.description: Manage URL redirects for your website

fields.description: Control what fields are being returned in the object.

search.description: Filter by items that contain the given search query in one of their fields.

sort.description: How to sort the returned items.

limit.description: Set the maximum number of items that will be returned

offset.description: How many items to skip when fetching data.

page.description: Cursor for use in pagination. Often used in combination with limit.

deep.description: Deep allows you to set any of the other query parameters on a nested relational dataset.

total_count.description: Returns the total item count of the collection you're querying.

filter_count.description: Returns the item count of the collection you're querying, taking the current filter/search parameters into account.

storage.description: Where the file is stored. Either `local` for the local filesystem or the name of the storage adapter (for example `s3`).

filename_disk.description: Name of the file on disk. By default, Directus uses a random hash for the filename.

filename_download.description: How you want to the file to be named when it's being downloaded.

title.description: Title for the file. Is extracted from the filename on upload, but can be edited by the user.

folder.description: Virtual folder where this file resides in.

filesize.description: Size of the file in bytes.

width.description: Width of the file in pixels. Only applies to images.

height.description: Height of the file in pixels. Only applies to images.

duration.description: Duration of the file in seconds. Only applies to audio and video.

embed.description: Where the file was embedded from.

location.description: Where the file was created. Is automatically populated based on Exif data for images.

tags.description: Tags for the file. Is automatically populated based on Exif data for images.

metadata.description: IPTC, Exif, and ICC metadata extracted from file

uploaded_on.description: When the file was last uploaded/replaced.

type.description: What type of link is this? Page and Post allow you to link to internal content. URL is for external content. Group can contain other menu items.

page.description: The internal page to link to.

post.description: The internal post to link to.

label.description: Text to include on the button.

button_group.description: The id of the Button Group this button belongs to.

url.description: The URL to link to. Could be relative (ie `/my-page`) or a full external URL (ie `https://docs.directus.io`)

headline.description: Larger main headline for this page section.

collection.description: The collection of content to fetch and display on the page within this block.

tagline.description: Smaller copy shown above the headline to label a section or add extra context.

buttons.description: Add individual buttons to the button group.

headline.description: Larger main headline for this page section.

button_group.description: Action buttons that show below headline and description.

description.description: Supporting copy that shows below the headline.

tagline.description: Smaller copy shown above the headline to label a section or add extra context.

layout.description: The layout for the component. You can set the image to display left, right, or in the center of page..

block_gallery.description: The id of the gallery block this item belongs to.

directus_file.description: The id of the file included in the gallery.

headline.description: Larger main headline for this page section.

tagline.description: Smaller copy shown above the headline to label a section or add extra context.

items.description: Images to include in the image gallery.

headline.description: Larger main headline for this page section.

tagline.description: Smaller copy shown above the headline to label a section or add extra context.

favicon.description: Small icon for browser tabs. 1:1 ratio. No larger than 512px × 512px.

logo.description: Main logo shown on the site (for light mode).

logo_dark_mode.description: Main logo shown on the site (for dark mode).

accent_color.description: Accent color for the website (used on buttons, links, etc).

headline.description: Larger main headline for this page section.

tagline.description: Smaller copy shown above the headline to label a section or add extra context.

pricing_cards.description: The individual pricing cards to display.

title.description: Name of the pricing plan. Shown at the top of the card.

description.description: Short, one sentence description of the pricing plan and who it is for.

price.description: Price and term for the pricing plan. (ie `$199/mo`)

badge.description: Badge that displays at the top of the pricing plan card to add helpful context.

features.description: Short list of features included in this plan. Press `Enter` to add another item to the list.

button.description: The action button / link shown at the bottom of the pricing card.

pricing.description: The id of the pricing block this card belongs to.

is_highlighted.description: Add highlighted border around the pricing plan to make it stand out.

name.description: Unique field identifier, not shown to users (lowercase, hyphenated)

label.description: Text label shown to form users.

placeholder.description: Default text shown in empty input.

help.description: Additional instructions shown below the input

validation.description: Available rules: `email`, `url`, `min:5`, `max:20`, `length:10`. Combine with pipes example: `email|max:255`

choices.description: Options for radio or select inputs

form.description: Parent form this field belongs to.

required.description: Make this field mandatory to complete.

navigation.description: Navigation menu that the individual links belong to.

page.description: The internal page to link to.

title.description: Label shown to the user for the menu item.

type.description: What type of link is this? Page and Post allow you to link to internal content. URL is for external content. Group can contain other menu items.

url.description: The URL to link to. Could be relative (ie `/my-page`) or a full external URL (ie `https://docs.directus.io`)

post.description: The internal post to link to.

children.description: Add child menu items within the group.

page.description: The id of the page that this block belongs to.

hide_block.description: Temporarily hide this block on the website without having to remove it from your page.

background.description: Background color for the block to create contrast. Does not control dark or light mode for the entire site.

content.description: Rich text content for this block.

headline.description: Larger main headline for this page section.

alignment.description: Controls how the content block is positioned on the page. Choose "Left" to align the block against the left margin or "Center" to position the block in the middle of the page. This setting affects the entire content block's placement, not the text alignment within it.

tagline.description: Smaller copy shown above the headline to label a section or add extra context.

is_active.description: Show or hide this form from the site.

id.description: Unique identifier for this menu. Can't be edited after creation.

title.description: What is the name of this menu? Only used internally.

is_active.description: Show or hide this menu from the site.

url_from.description: Old URL has to be relative to the site (ie `/blog` or `/news`). It cannot be a full url like (https://example.com/blog)

url_to.description: The URL you're redirecting to. This can be a relative url (/resources/matt-is-cool) or a full url (https://example.com/blog).

note.description: Short explanation of why the redirect was created.

content.description: Rich text content of your blog post.

image.description: Featured image for this post. Used in cards linking to the post and in the post detail page.

title.description: Title of the blog post (used in page title and meta tags)

description.description: Short summary of the blog post to entice readers.

author.description: Select the team member who wrote this post

published_at.description: Publish now or schedule for later.

permalink.description: Unique URL for this page (start with `/`, can have multiple segments `/about/me`)).

published_at.description: Publish now or schedule for later.

blocks.description: Create and arrange different content blocks (like text, images, or videos) to build your page.

Collection.description: Collection of which you want to retrieve the items from.
Collection.name: collection

Search.description: Filter by items that contain the given search query in one of their fields.
Search.name: search

Page.description: Cursor for use in pagination. Often used in combination with limit.
Page.name: page

Offset.description: How many items to skip when fetching data.
Offset.name: offset

Sort.description: How to sort the returned items. `sort` is a CSV of fields used to sort the fetched items. Sorting defaults to ascending (ASC) order but a minus sign (` - `) can be used to reverse this to descending (DESC) order. Fields are prioritized by their order in the CSV. You can also use a ` ? ` to sort randomly.
Sort.name: sort

Meta.description: What metadata to return in the response.
Meta.name: meta

Limit.description: A limit on the number of objects that are returned.
Limit.name: limit

Filter.description: Select items in collection by given conditions.
Filter.name: filter

Fields.description: Control what fields are being returned in the object.
Fields.name: fields

Export.name: export
Export.description: Saves the API response to a file. Accepts one of "csv", "json", "xml", "yaml".

Version.name: version
Version.description: Retrieve an item's state from a specific Content Version. The value corresponds to the "key" of the Content Version.
